translation.en: "Fuck are you lookin' at?"
"I've had it with these motherfuckin' snakes on this motherfuckin' plane."
translation.ko: '이 좆 같은 비행기에 있는 좆 같은 뱀 때문에 돌아버리겠어'

translation.en: "Fuck you. Fuck you. Fuck you. You're cool. Fuck you. I'm out."
translation.ko: '뻑큐, 뻑큐, 뻑큐 할머니는 짱, 뻑큐, 난 간다'

translation.en: "You want me to go trash your lights? You want me to fuckin' trash 'em?
Then why are you trashing my scene?"
"You are one ugly motherfucker."
"You have insulted me for the last fucking time."
"Fuck you! That's my name."
"Don't waste my motherfuckin' time."
"Fuck it. We'll do it live."
An actor's greatest tool is their imagination.
But swearing…
is definitely up there.
With swear words,
we can cut, soothe, delight,
translation.ko: 상처 주고, 달래고, 어르고 겁주고, 모욕주고

translation.en: frighten, insult, and seduce.
translation.ko: 상처 주고, 달래고, 어르고 겁주고, 모욕주고 유혹도 할 수 있죠

translation.en: Of all the swear words in the English language,
none is as malleable as "fuck."
It's capable of expressing the full range of human emotion.
translation.ko: 그 단어로 인간의 모든 감정을 표현할 수 있고요

translation.en: The pain, the wonder,
the unlawful carnal knowledge, in a single syllable.
translation.ko: 그리고 부적절한 육체관계도 이 한 음절로 표현해요

translation.en: [softly] ♪ Fuuuuuck ♪
Or we can say it like this…
[yells] Fuuuuuck!
They're the most popular and alluring taboos we have.
But the secrets to their strange power have been shrouded in mystery.
translation.ko: 그 독특한 힘의 비밀은 베일에 싸여있었습니다

translation.en: Until now.
Join me on a journey through the history,
translation.ko: 저와 함께 역사 속에서의 욕의 진화와

translation.en: evolution and cultural impact of swear words.
translation.ko: 저와 함께 역사 속에서의 욕의 진화와 욕이 문화에 끼친 영향을 살펴보시죠

translation.en: And let's get fucked.
"Fuck" is the all-time classic. Number one with a bullet.
translation.ko: '뻑'은 역대급 욕으로 아직도 인기 짱이에요 "짐 제프리스 코미디언"

translation.en: "Fuck" is another word that helps you release frustration.
translation.ko: "자이냅 존슨 코미디언" '뻑'은 짜증을 푸는 데 도움을 주는 단어예요

translation.en: It's-- it's a word that conveys emotion.
If I had only one swear word to take with me to a desert island,
translation.ko: "니키 글레이저 코미디언" 무인도에 욕을 딱 하나만 가져갈 수 있다면

translation.en: it would probably be "fuck."
My name is Kory Stamper.
I am a lexicographer and an author.
I used to write dictionary definitions at Merriam-Webster,
translation.ko: "'워드 바이 워드'의 저자" 전에는 메리엄-웹스터 사전에 단어의 정의를 썼는데

translation.en: and, among other things, my job there was to work on profanities.
translation.ko: 그중에서도 비속어의 정의가 제 주 분야였죠

translation.en: English, motherfucker. Do you speak it?
I love the word "fuck" so much. It's just so versatile.
translation.ko: 전 '뻑'이란 단어가 너무 좋아요 진짜 다양하게 쓰여요

translation.en: You can put it anywhere in a sentence, and give it a little bit of zhuzh.
translation.ko: 어느 곳에든 넣기만 하면 문장을 맛깔스럽게 해줘요

translation.en: My name is Ben Bergen and I'm a cognitive scientist.
translation.ko: 내 이름은 벤 버겐이고 인지 과학자예요

translation.en: I do research on language.
You can use "fuck" in absolutely any way.
I'll take you all to fuckin' hell.
We say "fuck" all the time. "What the fuck?"
"You little fucker." It could be a good thing.
translation.ko: '이 좆만 한 새끼' 좋은 의미도 돼요

translation.en: "Cheeky little fuck!"
It can be used in compound nouns like "fuckhead" and "fuckwit."
When something's really impressive, you go "Fuck!"
If you use it one way, you can offend people.
translation.ko: 이 욕을 쓰면 사람들을 화나게 할 수 있죠

translation.en: "Fuck you, Jack!"
Use it another way, you can make friends
translation.ko: 또 친구를 사귀거나 - 사람들에게 영향을 줄 수도 있죠 - 좆나 좋아!

translation.en: -and influence people. -"Fuck, yes!"
translation.ko: - 사람들에게 영향을 줄 수도 있죠 - 좆나 좋아!

translation.en: My name is Melissa Mohr
I have a PhD from Stanford University,
and I write about swearing.
If you hear someone say "fuck," that word has-- has a lot of power.
translation.ko: 누가 '뻑'이라고 하는 걸 들으면 그 말엔 큰 힘이 있어요

translation.en: It can work with when you're shocked.
"Fuck!"
It can work with when you're surprised.
"Shut the fuck up!"
"Fuck" is just the most acceptable curse word,
translation.ko: 제 생각에 '뻑'은 가장 널리 쓰는 욕이면서도

translation.en: but it still is the worst one of all.
But for all its myriad uses, "fuck" is ultimately about fuck-ing.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 많은 용례에도 '뻑'은 결국 '섹스'란 의미가 가장 커요

translation.en: So, where did the word itself come from?
[Ben] With "fuck,"
it has a really long history of not meaning something related to sex.
translation.ko: 역사 속에서 아주 오랫동안 '섹스'와는 아무 관련이 없었어요

translation.en: Thousands of years.
And, starting right around the beginning of the 14th century,
it gained this new meaning related to sex,
and probably preserved it
without ever being a banned term
for about 400 years.
So, there's an acronymic etymology
that people think the word "fuck" came from a phrase,
translation.ko: '뻑'이라는 단어의 유래를 이 구절로 보기도 하는데

translation.en: "Fornication Under Consent of the King."
-The idea is… -[neighing] …that when people in the middle ages got married,
they had to go to the king,
they had to ask for permission to have sex.
translation.ko: 섹스를 해도 되는지 허락을 받아야 했대요

translation.en: -[woman] Oh, don't stop! -[crashing]
Oh, I'm almost thither! [gasps]
-[horses neigh] -Halt this carriage!
I'm almost thither! -Almost! -[fanfare]
Cease this unsanctioned erogeny at once!
If you didn't have papers from the king, you were breaking the law.
translation.ko: 왕의 허가증 없이 하는 섹스는 불법이었어요

translation.en: But, my lord, you've given your consent.
translation.ko: 하지만 폐하께서 윤허하셨습니다 "F.U.C.K. 허가증 왕이 윤허한 성교"

translation.en: [king] Ah! Very well, then.
Let it be known that this household has been given
my royal, kingly consent
to fuuuuuck!
Such a great story for such a great word.
It is total horseshit. It's not real. Sadly.
translation.ko: 그런데 다 헛소리죠 안타깝게도 사실이 아니에요

translation.en: Because we like colorful words to have colorful origins.
translation.ko: 우린 흥미로운 단어엔 흥미로운 어원을 기대하거든요

translation.en: I think "fuck" is just made up.
I feel like this one guy one day just went, "Fuck."
And the other guy was like, "Oh, I kinda…
translation.ko: 다른 사람이 듣더니 '와, 지금 그 말이'

translation.en: That's exactly how I feel, actually."
The best that etymologists can tell,
"fuck" probably comes from a medieval Dutch verb,
which means "to blow," "to hit," "to strike."
What? "Fuck" means "to hit"?
You can fuck someone up by hitting them really hard.
translation.ko: 사람을 정말 세게 치면 완전히 망가뜨릴 수 있으니

translation.en: Technically, it still hasn't lost its original meaning.
translation.ko: 엄밀히 말하면 원래 의미를 잃진 않았네요

translation.en: So, if I got hit in the face, I would get fucked in the face?
translation.ko: 그럼 얼굴을 한 대 맞으면 얼굴로 섹스한 게 되나요?

translation.en: Talking to them's an uphill struggle, innit, Dad?
translation.ko: 저놈들과 말하는 거 좆나 힘들죠, 아버지?

translation.en: Fuck off!
[Melissa] "Fuck" doesn't appear very often in language
before the 1500s.
But there are some uses of the word, and they occur in people's names.
translation.ko: 하지만 가끔 사람들 이름에 쓰인 게 보이긴 합니다

translation.en: So, there's a man called John Lefucker.
Who was a known gigolo in the area.
translation.ko: 그 지역에서 유명한 기둥서방이었어요 "닉 오퍼먼 배우"

translation.en: [Melissa] There's somebody Fuckbutter.
Incredibly well endowed.
[Melissa] Somebody Roger Fuckebythenavele.
What? Are you crazy?
It could refer to the fact that he is, um…
translation.ko: 그 말은 이 사람이 섹스에 있어서

translation.en: an inelegant copulator.
But it could also mean that he got hit in the stomach.
translation.ko: 배를 맞았다는 의미도 될 수 있고

translation.en: Or that he punches people in the stomach.
translation.ko: 배를 때렸다는 의미도 될 수 있어요

translation.en: We just-- With names, you don't really know, because they tend to be metaphorical, or--
translation.ko: 이름으로는 알기가 힘든 게 비유적으로 쓰이는 경향이 있고

translation.en: You know, nicknames aren't necessarily explainable if you're outside of that in-group.
translation.ko: 별명은 그 단체에 속하지 않았으면 이해하기 힘들어요

translation.en: A lot of people's last names in English come from their profession,
translation.ko: 영어에서 많은 성이 주로 직업에서 유래하거나

translation.en: or some characteristic they're known by.
So you've got a Taylor. He would have sewn clothes.
A Miller would have ground grain, you know?
So, you've got-- In the 13th century, you've got John Lefucker.
What did he do? He-- You know, was he the original fuckboy?
[Nicolas] How many ways can we use "fuck"?
translation.ko: "뻑의 용례" '뻑'을 얼마나 다양하게 쓸 수 있을까요?

translation.en: There's so many different ways to talk about "fuck."
You have the Fuck Family Tree,
where Fuck meets Motherfuck,
and those two fuck and they have a Fuccboi.
He never gets married because he's always fuckin' around,
translation.ko: '뻑보이'는 난봉꾼 생활로 바빠서 결혼을 못 하지만

translation.en: but he had a Fuckwad and a Fuck Nut
with this absolute fuck fiend, Fuckin' Brenda.
They all fucked. But the motherfucker's brother,
Uncle Fucker, was a real sick fuck.
But he put them in the will, so the little fuckers run around
translation.ko: 조카 가족에게 재산을 물려줘 이 잡것들은

translation.en: with a fuck ton of money.
Then, there's the other fuckin' side of the family.
translation.ko: 그리고 뻑보이의 형제 쪽으로도 가족이 있는데

translation.en: They're all fuckin' dicks anyway.
"Fuck" means "sex," for sure.
And then you can move outward
and say, well, "fuck" also refers to really mess something up,
or "fuck" meaning "to screw someone over."
These are all metaphorical uses.
And-- and the fact that it's so taboo, and has been taboo for a while,
you know, it's kinda like Silly Putty-- you can stretch it
translation.ko: 어떻게 보면 슬라임 같아요 내가 원하는 어떤 의미로든 늘릴 수 있거든요

translation.en: into just about any meaning you need to.
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 어떤 의미로든 늘릴 수 있거든요

translation.en: [Nicolas] Where does "fuck" live in your brain?
When you automatically, spontaneously swear,
it's an evolutionary old reflex.
Apparently, swear words live in, like, a different part of your brain.
translation.ko: 욕과 관련된 단어는 뇌의 특정 부분에 살아요

translation.en: They live in, like, the mom's basement of your brain.
translation.ko: 뇌 속에 있는 엄마 집 지하실 같은 곳인데

translation.en: And I'm goin' to that part of my brain a lot.
translation.ko: 난 뇌의 그 부분에 자주 가요

translation.en: There's a deeper, more emotional,
translation.ko: 욕이 나오는 곳은 좀 더 깊고 감정적이고

translation.en: evolutionarily old place that profanity comes from.
Deep in the middle of the brain,
a part of the brain we share with other primates, with other mammals, with lizards.
translation.ko: 다른 영장류 및 포유류와 도마뱀류에게도 있는 곳인데

translation.en: That's the part that leads you to swear when you stub a toe,
translation.ko: 거기가 바로 발가락을 찧거나 좋아하는 풋볼팀이 터치다운을 할 때

translation.en: or when your favorite football team scores a touchdown.
translation.ko: 좋아하는 풋볼팀이 터치다운을 할 때 욕을 하게 만드는 그 부분이죠

translation.en: If something is tragic,
my reaction will involve the word "fuck."
When you swear, you produce adrenaline.
It's part of the same fight-or-flight reaction people have
translation.ko: 사람들이 공포나 분노를 느낄 때 경험하는

translation.en: when they experience fear or anger.
It can cause the listener's heart rate to increase,
make your palms sweat.
You fuckin' do that again and I will shoot you myself.
translation.ko: 또 그러면 내가 널 쏴버릴 거야

translation.en: That adrenaline and the blood flow to the extremities
translation.ko: 그 아드레날린이 수족 말단으로 피를 흐르게 하면

translation.en: makes it easier to tolerate pain there.
It's also the same reason why swearing makes you stronger.
translation.ko: 욕을 하면 터프해지는 것도 같은 이유죠

translation.en: For example, five percent stronger in grip strength
when you're swearing, compared to when you're not.
[Nicolas] "Fuck!"
It's so primal, so universal,
that some of history's most famous people channeled its power
translation.ko: 역사적으로 유명한 몇몇 사람들은 그 말의 힘을 빌려 마지막을 남기기도 했는데요

translation.en: for their last words.
translation.ko: 그 말의 힘을 빌려 마지막을 남기기도 했는데요

translation.en: Like beloved children's author Roald Dahl.
translation.ko: 사랑받는 어린이 책 작가 로알드 달이 그랬죠

translation.en: "It's just that I will miss you all so much."
-[squirt] -"Ow, fuck!"
-[church bell tolls] -Or notorious people lover W. C. Fields.
translation.ko: 고약한 인류애로 유명한 W.C. 필즈도 있습니다

translation.en: "God damn the whole fuckin' world and everyone in it but you, Carlotta."
translation.ko: '칼로타, 당신만 빼고 이 빌어먹을 세상을 저주해'

translation.en: And even Venezuelan freedom fighter, Antonio José de Sucre.
translation.ko: 베네수엘라의 자유 투쟁가 안토니오 호세 데 수크레도 그랬죠

translation.en: -[gunshot] -"Fuck, a bullet wound."
Every single person who's fallen off a cliff, their last word was "fuck."
translation.ko: 그리고 절벽에서 떨어지는 사람들 다 마지막에 '뻑'이라고 했어요

translation.en: Everyone who's been eaten by a shark, they also said "fuck."
I'm not surprised.
I feel like that's probably a lot of people's last words.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 마지막으로 그 말을 남길걸요

translation.en: I'm Elvis Mitchel,
and I host a show called The Treatment on KCRW.
Thanks to the Supreme Court and the ruling of 1971,
"fuck" is part of our protected speech, we have the right to say it.
translation.ko: '뻑'도 표현의 자유에 들어가 그걸 말할 권리를 얻었어요

translation.en: We have what they would call "the God-given right."
Using the word "fuck" becomes a way to be heard.
Certainly-- In the '60s, Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland,
they had a touring troupe, FTA. Fuck The Army.
translation.ko: FTA라는 순회 극단을 운영했는데 바로 '뻑킹 군대'와

translation.en: And Fuck The Draft.
You were using that word to say, "I was taking a stand."
translation.ko: 그 단어를 사용해서 확고한 의지를 드러냈고요

translation.en: "Fuck" is also something a person says when they are deeply hurt
translation.ko: '뻑'은 또 아주 깊이 상처받았거나 뭔가에 크게 실망했을 때

translation.en: or disappointed by something.
♪ Fuck tha police Comin' straight from the underground… ♪
translation.ko: 지하에서 말하는데 잘 들어 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'

translation.en: When NWA said "Fuck Tha Police,"
translation.ko: NWA가 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'이라고 했을 때

translation.en: it wasn't said out of a sense of pure malice.
It was said with a deep sense of disappointment.
♪ Fuck tha police ♪
♪ Fuck, fuck, fuck tha police ♪
-♪ Fuck, fuck, fuck… ♪ -That's what "Fuck Tha Police" did.
translation.ko: 그게 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'이 한 일이었죠

translation.en: That's what those words did.
The power of NWA is that they were
some of the earliest successful gangsta rappers,
and what gangsta rap really meant in that time…
translation.ko: 그 당시 갱스터 랩의 진정한 의미는

translation.en: was people sayin' things on songs
that people were not used to hearing in public.
translation.ko: 사람들이 공공장소에서 못 듣는 얘기를 노래에 담는 것이었어요

translation.en: Going to a Public Enemy show
or NWA in the '80s, and just watching the way Eazy-E--
translation.ko: NWA 공연에 가서 이지-E를 보는 건…

translation.en: It became lyrical, the way he used the word "fuck."
♪ …fucked up incident? ♪
And to watch the way Cube would react, and basically sort of--
translation.ko: 그리고 아이스 큐브가 반응하는 걸 보면 뭐랄까…

translation.en: They'd do this call and response. That to me was art.
translation.ko: 둘이서 주거니 받거니 하는 건 내겐 예술이었어요

translation.en: That was raising profanity to the level of art.
And making that part of art,
becomes part of a conversation we have every day, forever after.
translation.ko: 그 후로는 우리 일상 대화의 일부가 됐어요

translation.en: And, of course, the police did not like to hear this sentiment.
translation.ko: 물론 경찰은 이런 분위기가 마음에 안 들었겠죠

translation.en: [woman] The group is NWA.
The group's lyrics are anti-police and anti-authority.
I'm personally very offended.
♪ Fuck tha police ♪
[Open Mike] They didn't invent the term "fuck the police."
translation.ko: 그 그룹이 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'이란 말을 만든 건 아니지만

translation.en: But they said it out loud.
And it was analogous that that same year, 1989,
Public Enemy says "Fight The Power."
So you got "Fight The Power" in New York,
and you got "Fuck Tha Police" in LA.
translation.ko: LA에서는 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'이 울려 퍼졌어요

translation.en: It's the same sentiment.
It's just people finally saying these things on record,
because we have this new form of expression called rap music
translation.ko: 랩 음악이라는 새로운 표현 방식이 생겨

translation.en: where it's okay to say things that you've been saying in secret.
translation.ko: 비밀스럽게 말하던 것을 표현할 수 있게 됐거든요

translation.en: [Zainab] When you hear people say "Fuck the police,"
translation.ko: 사람들이 '좆 까, 경찰 놈들'을 외치는 건

translation.en: it's like, "I have no other options.
And that's how I got here. Because there's no other option."
translation.ko: 다른 방법이 없어서 이 지경이 됐단 얘길 하는 거죠

translation.en: "Fuck" is a good protest word,
because it is the swear word that carries the most emotion.
[Elvis] People need to be offended, to be shaken out of their complacency,
translation.ko: 사람들은 기분 상해봐야 해요 안락한 상황에서

translation.en: out of their misguided belief system.
translation.ko: 그리고 잘못된 신념에서 벗어날 필요가 있어요

translation.en: ♪ Fuck tha police ♪
According to numerous studies,
"fuck" is not only the most used swear word in the English language,
it's also the most censored.
It's the granddaddy of cussing, and we can find it all around us.
translation.ko: 욕설의 할아버지 격이자 어디서든 눈에 띄어요

translation.en: It's one of the oldest, most vulgar words we have,
translation.ko: 우리가 사용하는 욕설 중 가장 오래된 것이기도 하며

translation.en: limitless in its ability to shock and offend.
So, why do we see it now on cross-stitch
translation.ko: 그런데 왜 이 말이 십자수에 등장하고

translation.en: and scented candles?
And if we see it everywhere,
why is it still censored on TV and in movies?
translation.ko: 왜 아직도 TV와 영화에서 검열을 받을까요?

translation.en: Often there will be censorship.
Uh, generally, it's not government censorship,
although it can be, like in the case of the Soviet Union.
translation.ko: 소련 같은 경우는 정부의 검열도 있긴 하지만요

translation.en: Often, it's people self-censoring,
like, just deciding that this is not… these words have no place in public discourse.
translation.ko: 이 말이 대중에겐 적합하지 않다고 결론짓거나

translation.en: they're harmful to morality, they're harmful to children,
and so, we will not say these things.
And of course, everybody does. But then they're shocked.
translation.ko: 그런데도 다들 쓰니까 거기서 충격을 받아요

translation.en: People just laugh when you say "fuck."
It's just… everything's fuckin' funnier when you say "fuck."
I feel like swear words are definitely more powerful in America.
translation.ko: 내 생각에 욕설은 미국에서 더 힘이 있어요

translation.en: Not that powerful in Britain.
You can say, "Morning, you fucking cunt" to someone and they'll be fine.
translation.ko: '잘 잤어, 미친년'이라고 하면 별로 신경 안 쓰는데

translation.en: Say that to someone in America, you'll get shot,
because guns are legal here.
When you're being offended, you're basically saying to the world,
translation.ko: 기분이 상했단 것은 세상에 이렇게 말하는 거죠 '난 얘보다 도덕성이 뛰어나'

translation.en: "I have better morals than this person."
translation.ko: 세상에 이렇게 말하는 거죠 '난 얘보다 도덕성이 뛰어나'

translation.en: "This person did this, but I'm better than them."
They're not going home and going,
translation.ko: 집에 가서 혼자 이러진 않죠 '그런 말을 듣다니 정말 어이가 없네'

translation.en: "I couldn't believe the words I had to hear…"
And if they are, they can fuck off. Like, what's the point?
translation.ko: 정말 그런다면 웃기지 말라고 해요 도대체 왜요?

translation.en: They shouldn't be out in the general public and all that stuff.
translation.ko: 그럼 밖에 나가 사람들과 어울리면 안 되죠

translation.en: I think the word "fuck" has a baseline magic
that can never be removed.
If somebody looks at you and says, "Fuck you,"
you're gonna feel that.
Just because it's more common, doesn't mean it's lost any power.
translation.ko: 흔하게 쓴다고 해서 그 힘을 잃은 건 아니죠

translation.en: Those fucking killjoys at the Motion Picture Association of America
translation.ko: 흥 깨는 데 일가견 있는 미국 영화 협회 얼간이들은

translation.en: still consider the word bad enough to slap an R rating
translation.ko: 아직도 그 단어만 들어가면 'R 등급'을 매겨요

translation.en: on just about any movie that uses it more than twice.
translation.ko: 그 말이 두 번 이상 들어가는 영화는 전부요

translation.en: Until the 1960s,
you got-- basically you were graded by the Hays Code.
And there were things you just couldn't say.
Then Jack Valenti came along and the MPAA said,
translation.ko: 그러다 미국 영화 협회가 생기고 잭 발렌티가 등장했죠

translation.en: "Well, we're losing people.
There are movies coming from Europe where people talk about sex,
translation.ko: '유럽에서 만든 영화에선 사람들이 섹스 얘기를 하고'

translation.en: and they apparently have sex in these movies.
We can't act like that doesn't happen anymore."
translation.ko: '더는 그런 일이 없는 것처럼 행동할 순 없어요'

translation.en: So, you had to acknowledge that the real world existed.
translation.ko: 그런 세상이 존재한다는 걸 인정해야 했어요

translation.en: And the ratings offered ways to gently introduce the concept
translation.ko: 그리고 등급제가 실제 세상의 개념을 영화로 서서히 들여올 방법을 줬고요

translation.en: of the real world to movies.
translation.ko: 실제 세상의 개념을 영화로 서서히 들여올 방법을 줬고요

translation.en: With these rating, a G-rated movie
will have a lot of sunlight, and that's about it.
That'll do, pig.
That'll do.
You get to PG and there are levels of violence,
translation.ko: PG 등급으로 가면 폭력 장면도 좀 있고

translation.en: maybe a couple of swear words.
Son of a bitch.
For PG-13, you can use the word "fuck" and get away with it once.
translation.ko: PG13 등급은 '뻑'을 딱 한 번 쓸 수 있어요

translation.en: From the entire Channel 4 News team, I'm Veronica Corningstone.
translation.ko: 채널 4 뉴스팀에서 전합니다 전 베로니카 코닝스톤이고

translation.en: And I'm Ron Burgundy.
Go fuck yourself, San Diego.
It can't be about fucking.
And then you get to R,
and you have movies where characters talk like real people.
translation.ko: 그리고 R 등급에 가면 배우들이 현실 속 사람들처럼 얘기해요

translation.en: Are you fucking kidding me?
Profanity was the life-preserver for movies.
People went to the movies again.
I think the first time I heard a curse was in the movies.
translation.ko: 제가 처음 욕을 접한 게 영화였어요

translation.en: I think my parents took us to see Coming to America.
Once they got to, like, Queens,
he was like, "We've arrived," or something.
And somebody was like, "Fuck you!" And he was like, "Yes, yes! Fuck you too!"
[Sarah Silverman] I was in, um… School of Rock,
and I remember, in between scenes, the director was saying, uh…
translation.ko: 촬영을 쉴 때 감독님이 한 얘기가 기억나요

translation.en: "It's PG-13, so we can say 'shit' and we can say one 'fuck.'"
translation.ko: 'PG13 등급이라 '쉿'은 되지만 '뻑'은 딱 한 번만 돼요'

translation.en: I pitched that, um, you don't use "fuck" at all,
translation.ko: 제가 제안했죠 극 중에선 '뻑'을 쓰지 말고

translation.en: and then just the last, like, after the credits,
every-- you know, the whole cast just goes, "Fuck!"
They didn't do that.
Swearing in movies is big business.
Just look at the filmography of one randomly generated actor.
translation.ko: 여기 무작위로 뽑은 한 배우의 출연 영화를 보세요

translation.en: You can see that of the big six swear words,
"fuck" and its derivatives are by far the most frequent,
making up 71% of the curses uttered in the films of this random actor.
translation.ko: 이 무작위로 뽑은 배우가 내뱉는 욕설의 71%나 돼요

translation.en: So who do you think is the sweariest actor of all time?
translation.ko: 역대 최고로 욕을 많이 하는 배우는 누구일까요?

translation.en: Per movies, per swear words,
per time on screen, I think Eddie Murphy is your number one.
translation.ko: 화면에 나오는 시간으로 보나 에디 머피가 최고라고 생각해요

translation.en: No. Samuel L. It has to be Samuel L.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 새뮤얼 L. 잭슨요 새뮤얼이 최고죠

translation.en: He's swearin'-- He don't get the role unless he can swear in it.
translation.ko: 욕이 없는 영화에서는 배역을 맡지도 않아요

translation.en: When you're talking about the word "fuck,"
it's hard not to really fall back on the connoisseur of fuck,
Samuel L. Jackson.
What the fuck am I doin' in the back?
You're the motherfucker should be on brain detail.
translation.ko: 자세한 계획은 네가 짜야지 이 좆만아

translation.en: I remember I went to see Snakes on a Plane only to see Samuel L. Jackson say,
translation.ko: '스네이크 온 어 플레인'을 본 건 새뮤얼 L. 잭슨 대사 때문이었어요

translation.en: "I'm tired of these motherfuckin' snakes on this motherfuckin' plane."
translation.ko: '저 좆 같은 비행기에 탄 좆 같은 뱀 때문에 돌겠어'

translation.en: It was-- it was magical.
The sweariest actor isn't Samuel L. Jackson,
translation.ko: 가장 욕 많이 하는 배우는 새뮤얼 L. 잭슨도

translation.en: Al Pacino, or my personal favorite, Yosemite Sam,
translation.ko: 알 파치노도 내가 좋아하는 요세미티 샘도 아닌

translation.en: but… Jonah Hill.
And while Jonah Hill is known for his R-rated comedies,
translation.ko: 조나 힐은 R 등급 코미디로 유명세를 탔지만

translation.en: it was The Wolf of Wall Street that made him the king of the curse words,
translation.ko: 그가 욕설의 왕으로 등극한 건 '더 울프 오브 월 스트리트'로

translation.en: swearing a confounding 107 times in that movie alone.
-Jonah Hill? -Jonah Hill?
There's no-- Who's counting these? This is-- That's not true! That's not true!
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼, 누가 셌어요? 거짓말이에요

translation.en: How did Jonah Hill say it so many times?
It wasn't until 2004 that "fuck" first arrived
translation.ko: 그리고 2004년이 되어서야 '뻑'이 처음으로 작은 화면에 검열 없이 등장했어요

translation.en: uncensored on the small screen
translation.ko: '뻑'이 처음으로 작은 화면에 검열 없이 등장했어요

translation.en: in an airing of South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut
on Comedy Central.
But it was way back in 1970,
when M*A*S*H dropped the first F-bomb in a major motion picture.
translation.ko: 첫 폭탄을 터뜨린 인기 프로로 '매시'가 있었죠

translation.en: Movies can still move the needle when it comes to characters…
translation.ko: 영화는 여전히 큰 힘을 발휘해요 등장인물이

translation.en: basically, in effect, inventing catchphrases.
We see this happen with, uh… with newly-invented swear words.
translation.ko: 새로 만든 욕이 퍼지는 걸 보면 알 수 있는데요

translation.en: So MILF is the great example,
because we know exactly the thing that spread it throughout the world,
which was this movie, which was American Pie in 1999.
translation.ko: 이 단어가 전 세계로 퍼지는 걸 봤으니까요

translation.en: [John Cho] M-I-L-F.
-A Mom I'd Like to Fuck. -[laughing] Yeah, dude!
If the best movies can do something that make us want to be like them,
translation.ko: 영화가 훌륭하면 누구나 그 영화를 따라 하고 싶어 하고

translation.en: and we hear something and, "Wow, that's perfect. That…
translation.ko: 뭔가를 듣고 이러기도 하죠 '와, 그거 멋진데'

translation.en: MILF? I'm usin' that. I'm gonna find a way to use that."
And you hear that in American Pie, and then, ten years later,
on 30 Rock, there's a fake reality show called MILF Island.
translation.ko: '30 록'에 '밀프 아일랜드'란 가짜 리얼리티 프로가 나와요

translation.en: And it's everywhere. I mean, so…
translation.ko: 이젠 흔하게 쓰여요 영화는 여전히 흥미로운 방법으로

translation.en: movies still can… act as these catalysts
translation.ko: 영화는 여전히 흥미로운 방법으로 언어를 살아있게 하는 촉매 역할을 하고 있어요

translation.en: for keeping the language alive in ways that are exciting.
translation.ko: 언어를 살아있게 하는 촉매 역할을 하고 있어요

translation.en: I love "fuck."
It's like the Tom Hanks of curse words.
It can do anything, can be in anything, and we never get sick of it.
translation.ko: 못 하는 게 없고, 어디든 있고 절대 질리지도 않아요

translation.en: We need to be able to say swear words.
We need to be able to say "fuck."
It's a gateway for creativity,
it's a form of protest, and…
it's good for us.
-[bell dings] -I think there's a need now
translation.ko: "뻑" 지금은 욕설과 비속어가 다른 때보다 더 필요해요

translation.en: for swearing and profanity more than any other time.
translation.ko: 지금은 욕설과 비속어가 다른 때보다 더 필요해요

translation.en: We need the relief, the release. That's really what profanity gives us.
translation.ko: 해소할 수단이 필요한데 비속어가 그게 돼 주죠

translation.en: "Oh, shit!"
Just a chance to get that kind of stuff out.
Bitch. Fuck. Shit. Damn. Pussy. Dick.
translation.ko: 비치, 뻑, 쉿, 댐, 푸시, 딕

translation.en: I like that there are words you can't say
and that you can only say on special occasions.
translation.ko: 특별한 때에만 쓸 수 있는 이런 말이 좋아요

translation.en: Like Christmas.
Swearing is important if you need it to get out your frustration
translation.ko: 절망과 짜증에서 벗어나려고 욕설을 사용하는 것은

translation.en: or your despair.
What the fuck?
It's not important when you're just swearing for swearing's sake.
translation.ko: 그런데 그냥 욕을 하고 싶어서 하는 건 안 돼요

translation.en: Don't swear for swearing's sake. We're better than that.
translation.ko: 하고 싶다고 하지 마세요 우리도 격이 있지

translation.en: Swear because you mean it.
translation.ko: 욕은 꼭 해야 할 때만 해요

translation.en: I'm Nicolas Cage.
Have a great fuckin' night.
